attributes.action: lobby the Bank of England to increase the number of £5 notes in circulation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I could not be more fed up of being given a massive handful of change every time I buy a packet of Polos.  Is there no-one in this country who can sort this madness out?

I am seeking to organise a powerful coalition of retailers, banks and consumers to lobby for an increase in the number of £5 notes in circulation in the UK.

This measure could be cost neutral for the tax payer, if increases in £5 notes were off-set with reductions of other coinage (I suggest reducing the near useless and oversized 2p as an initial measure).

The only possible down-side that I can imagine is a reduction in trade for pocket repairers.

Please support this important quality of life measure.
